channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Wellness trends worth taking into the new year (and some that aren't)
item.description: We reported on all sorts of products and practices promising to make you healthy last year. Here are the ones that stood up to science, and those that were mostly hype.
item.content:encoded: We reported on all sorts of products and practices promising to make you healthy last year. Here are the ones that stood up to science, and those that were mostly hype.
item.dc:creator: Andrea Muraskin

item.title: A tale of two U.S. interventions and why Venezuela is not Panama 2.0
item.description: Operation Absolute Resolve, that resulted in the capture of Nicolás Maduro, echoes the 1990 U.S. invasion of Panama that brought down Manuel Noriega. But big differences abound.
item.content:encoded:
Operation Absolute Resolve, that resulted in the capture of Nicolás Maduro, echoes the 1990 U.S. invasion of Panama that brought down Manuel Noriega. But big differences abound.

(Image credit: Federico Parra)
item.dc:creator: Frank Langfitt

item.title: Trump wants U.S. oil companies in Venezuela. Here's what to know
item.description: President Trump wants more U.S. oil companies to "go in" to Venezuela. But there are economic, historical, and climate reasons that may not be easy. Here's what you need to know about oil in Venezuela.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump wants more U.S. oil companies to "go in" to Venezuela. But there are economic, historical, and climate reasons that may not be easy. Here's what you need to know about oil in Venezuela.

(Image credit: Matias Delacroix)
item.dc:creator: Julia Simon

item.title: Trump tried to bury evidence of the Jan. 6 riot. NPR's archive preserves the facts
item.description: NPR's Jan. 6 archive brings together reporting, video, documents and testimony to show what really happened during the Capitol riot. Explore the timeline, cases and evidence behind the attack.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Jan. 6 archive brings together reporting, video, documents and testimony to show what really happened during the Capitol riot. Explore the timeline, cases and evidence behind the attack.
item.dc:creator: Tom Dreisbach

item.title: Venezuelans wonder who's in charge as Trump claims contact with Maduro's deputy
item.description: Venezuelans scrambled to understand who was in charge of their country after the U.S. captured Nicolás Maduro. President Trump offered an answer: The United States would take control of Venezuela.
item.content:encoded:
Venezuelans scrambled to understand who was in charge of their country after the U.S. captured Nicolás Maduro. President Trump offered an answer: The United States would take control of Venezuela.

(Image credit: Ariana Cubillos)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Who is María Corina Machado, Venezuela's Nobel Peace Prize winning opposition leader?
item.description: The United States has captured Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro. Opposition leader María Corina Machado has been one of his biggest critics.
item.content:encoded:
The United States has captured Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro. Opposition leader María Corina Machado has been one of his biggest critics.

(Image credit: Stian Lysberg Solum)
item.dc:creator: Alana Wise

item.title: Maduro arrives in New York. What to know about the U.S. operation in Venezuela
item.description: President Trump said the U.S. would "run" Venezuela, following the capture of President Nicolás Maduro on Saturday. But many questions remain about what's next.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump said the U.S. would "run" Venezuela, following the capture of President Nicolás Maduro on Saturday. But many questions remain about what's next.

(Image credit: Jesus Vargas)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: Six questions about the capture of Maduro
item.description: On a day when most reporters are chasing facts, NPR's Morning Edition host Steve Inskeep has a few questions.
item.content:encoded:
On a day when most reporters are chasing facts, NPR's Morning Edition host Steve Inskeep has a few questions.

(Image credit: Matias Delacroix)
item.dc:creator: Steve Inskeep

item.title: Maduro faces drug charges in U.S. even as Trump freed others convicted of trafficking
item.description: Just last month, President Trump freed former Honduran President Juan Orlando Hernandez, who had been convicted in the U.S. of helping smuggle more than 400 tons of cocaine into the country.
item.content:encoded:
Just last month, President Trump freed former Honduran President Juan Orlando Hernandez, who had been convicted in the U.S. of helping smuggle more than 400 tons of cocaine into the country.

(Image credit: JIM WATSON)
item.dc:creator: Brian Mann

item.title: Photos: Aftermath of strikes in Venezuela
item.description: Pictures show the aftermath of the U.S. strikes in Venezuela and the reaction from around the world.
item.content:encoded:
Pictures show the aftermath of the U.S. strikes in Venezuela and the reaction from around the world.

(Image credit: Matias Delacroix)
item.dc:creator: NPR Staff
